message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about magnification and the tools used for it. In order to read very small text on a pill bottle, a magnifier is necessary. Option (A) is a tool used to view objects at a cellular or microscopic level and is not necessary for reading small text on a pill bottle. Option (B) is a tool used to view objects at a distance and is not suitable for reading small text up close. Option (D) is also a tool used for viewing objects at a distance and is not suitable for reading small text up close.

A microscope is used to see even smaller details at a higher magnification level. A telescope is used for viewing objects at a distance, not for close-up examination. Binoculars are used for viewing distant objects with both eyes, not for magnifying small text. Therefore, option (C) is the correct answer.
